mobs.long_desc: The Grey Guardian is protecting this entrance.
mobs.desc: This is one of the noble Grey Guardians, sworn to protect the Paladin's Guild at any cost. His life of fighting evil makes him a most worthy opponent!

mobs.keywords: knight grey grey-knight paladin guildmaster master
mobs.long_desc: The Grey Knight, your guildmaster, is standing here.
mobs.desc: This is your master, the legendary Grey Knight! He is large and tough looking. Battle-scarred and wizened by the years, you know the Grey Knight has been defending the innocent since long before you were born!

mobs.long_desc: A powerful monk blocks the entrance into the guild.
mobs.desc: He stands here with his head up high.  He has mastered all of the skills which he desires and can conquer anything he chooses.  This monk would make for a most deadly opponent.

mobs.keywords: monk master guildmaster head-monk high most-high
mobs.long_desc: A peaceful monk, your guildmaster, is standing here.
mobs.desc: This man has fought more demons than one could ever imagine.  He stands here full of confidence, knowing that his days of fighting are over, and his days of teaching have just begun.

mobs.long_desc: A stern looking woman with pointed glasses watches the door to the archives.
mobs.desc: This woman is dressed like a typical troubadour but something about her movements is jarring for a performer of this rank.  Perhaps she might be a loaner member from the Mercenary Guild rather than the Bard Guild.

mobs.long_desc: The Master Herald, head of the guild, hums as she reads some old music.
mobs.desc: Brilliance and a knack for memorization helped elevate this woman to the head of the Order.  As head of the Order, it is her job to know and retell the lineages and titles of all the noble families in Caelia, as well as the protocols for greeting and announcing formal visitors to Grey Castle. Additionally her elven lifespan allows for plenty of time for learning, making her an ideal knowledge keeper.  Her light but full voice pitch-perfectly carries the notes of the centuries-old sheet music she is reading through.

mobs.long_desc: Pumahl the Beast Master watches the hall.
mobs.desc: Before you stands the great Beast Master Pumahl.  Long brown hair accentuates their lithe, firmly muscled body which is wrapped in an assortment of furs and hides.  Pumahl is thin for a barbarian, though still exceptionally tall for a humanoid.  They watch the Hall with the sharp focus of a trained tracker and an unnerving stillness uncommon to most barbarians.

mobs.long_desc: Honus, Treasure Hunter extraordinaire, surveys the massive pile of wealth.
mobs.desc: Standing at 6 feet tall with a lean, athletic build, Honus possesses an air of confident charm that draws attention wherever he goes.  His piercing hazel eyes are always alert, constantly scanning his surroundings for clues and hidden treasures.  Honus has a chiseled jawline and churlish smile that adds to his roguish appeal.  His short, tousled chestnut hair is hidden beneath a wide-brimmed hat that shields him from the elements during his daring expeditions.

mobs.long_desc: A wizened old monk maintains the mandala.
mobs.desc: The wizened old man before you is the Keeper of the Mandala.  Hakujo's dress indicates he is not of the Grey Castle Order, but a Yamabushi, a mountain warrior monk, one of the esoteric orders of monks.  He is dressed in a billowing white robe which is tied up around the forearms and shins.  Over it he wears a voluminous tan sleeveless outer robe and gold-embroidered harness-collar with large red tufts which represent the climbing ropes Yamabushi use outdoors.  His long white hair and beard stand in stark contrast to his deep tan skin, a typical complexion for people from Odaishyozen.

rooms.name: The Grey Castle
rooms.description: You are standing just inside the Entrance to the Grey Castle.  From here, you can return to the entrance to the north or you can follow the hallway south.

rooms.name: The Grey Castle
rooms.description: You are standing in a hallway inside the Grey Castle.  From here, the hallway continues on north and south.

East.description: You see the Entrance to the Paladin's Guild.

rooms.name: The Grey Castle
rooms.description: You are standing in a hallway inside the Grey Castle.  From here, the hallway continues on north.  To the south stands the magnificent courtyard of the Grey Castle.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Paladin's Guild
rooms.description: This is the entrance to the Inner Sanctum of the Grey Guardian's Paladin Guild.  It is decorated with with ornate tapestries and a number of very valuable looking paintings.  The Paladin's Inner Sanctum lies to the east. The Grey Castle is to the west.

East.description: You see the Paladin's Inner Sanctum.

rooms.name: The Paladin's Inner Sanctum
rooms.description: You stand in the noblest part of the Grey Castle, the Inner Sanctum of the Paladin's Guild.  The room is ornately decorated with tokens of nobility gathered by its members over the centuries.  It is indeed a privilege to be here!  The only exit is to the west.

West.description: You see the Entrance to the Paladin's Guild.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Monk's Guild
rooms.description: This is the entrance to the Inner Sactum of the Monk's Guild.  Only one who posses incredible hand control and mental focus is allowed inside.  The room is not overly decorated but it is kept in very good condition.  The Inner Sanctum lies to the east.

rooms.name: The Inner Sactum of the Monk's Guild
rooms.description: A feeling of serenity engrosses all who step into this room.  There are large practice poles setup throughout the room for the mastering of barehand combat.  There are also ledges setup here to ensure a safe fall from an accidental slip.  This training area is highly sophisticated and your guildmaster ensures that all work done here is to the finest degree of precision.

rooms.name: The Grey Castle Courtyard
rooms.description: The internal courtyard of Grey Castle is a place of grand magnificence. Pristine columns of Caelian marble with vaulted arches square off the expansive open-air plaza.  A dazzling tile mosaic spreads out across the ground celebrating the storied history of the Grey Castle.  The inner sections of the Grey Castle are still closed, but to the east is the entrance to the Grand Court.

rooms.name: The Grand Court
rooms.description: Standing beyond the courtyard is the Grand Court, home of the Order of Heralds, one of the many branches of the Bard Guild.  The Court itself is a combination of massive ballroom, small orchestral chambers, and library, ideal for a large variety of events and gatherings.  The ballroom is lined with floor to ceiling velvet curtains.  The ceiling is painted with a massive mural depicting musicians and storytellers performing in a gentle pastoral setting. Branching off the ballroom are a number of small chambers with cushioned chairs for instrumentalists to sit on and practice.  Beyond is the inner archives of the heralds, tale keepers, and historians of the Grey Castle.  Those who hold centuries of stories, the lore which gives the Grey Castle its legitimacy to watch over the sleepy forest village of Mielikki.

rooms.name: The Bardic Archives
rooms.description: These archives are the headquarters of the Order of Heralds.  Performers of all stripes - musicians, actors, dancers, storytellers, minstrels, troubadours, and more - belong to this branch of the Bard Guild.  The archives themselves are packed with books and papers detailing all kinds of musical masterworks, tales of adventure, royal family trees, ancient plays, everything needed to properly herald the nobles of Caelia.

rooms.name: The Hall of the Knights of Dragonfire
rooms.description: As you enter the room, the first thing you notice is the sheer size of the space.  The room is vast and cavernous, with high ceilings and rows upon rows of weapons and armor lining the walls.  The air is filled with the sound of metal clanging against metal as guild members hone their weapons and prepare for the next dragon hunt.  In the back of the hall, a large training area is set up, complete with dummies and targets for members to practice their combat skills.  The training area is always bustling with activity, as members hone their abilities in preparation for the next dragon hunt.

rooms.name: The Hall of Hunters
rooms.description: The Hall of Hunters is a dimly lit room, illuminated by flickering torches mounted on the walls.  The atmosphere is thick with the smell of leather and smoke.  The room is spacious, with a high ceiling and a polished wooden floor that creaks slightly underfoot. The walls are adorned with a plethora of hunting trophies, ranging from the menacing fangs of a werewolf to the glittering scales of a dragon.  Mounted above the fireplace is the skull of a giant sea serpent, its empty eye sockets glowering down on the room below.  Rows of antlers and horns from various creatures line the walls, creating a veritable museum of monsters.

rooms.name: The Treasure Vault
rooms.description: The walls of the vault are adorned with ornate tapestries, procured through means legitimate and nefarious, depicting everything from grand family trees to vivid battles. The vaulted ceiling is adorned with a constellation of enchanted gems that emit a gentle, mesmerizing glow, casting the room in a dazzling display of colors. The treasures themselves are displayed in an array of elaborate pedestals, alcoves, and glass cases. They include piles of glittering gold coins, sparkling gemstones of all shapes and sizes, enchanted weapons with blades that shimmer with otherworldly power, exquisite jewelry adorned with rare and precious gems, ancient scrolls containing spells of untold power, and priceless relics of legendary heroes.

rooms.name: Hall of the Great Mandala
rooms.description: The highly domed chamber is a space designed for contemplation, meditation, and spiritual exploration.  In the center is a massive, many chambered tile circle composed of intricate patterns and sacred geometry to enhance a meditative experience, known as a mandala.  Cushions ring the mandala and are placed at designated points across the design for more comfort during seated meditation.  Soft, diffused lighting along with the gentle sound of trickling water is used to create a serene atmosphere within the chamber.

extras.text: The mandala encompasses nearly the entire floor.  Traditional colors - deep blues, rich reds, vibrant yellows, and calming greens - are incorporated to stimulate different chakras and aspects of consciousness.
